greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of (3+sqrt(17))/2.
comment: Continued fraction expansion of (3+sqrt(17))/2 is A109007.

The rectangle R whose shape (i.e., length/width) is (3+sqrt(17))/2 can be partitioned into rectangles of shapes 3 and 3/2 in a manner that matches the periodic continued fraction [3, 3/2, 3, 3/2, ...].  R can also be partitioned into squares so as to match the periodic continued fraction [3, 1, 1, 3, 1, 1,...].  For details, see A188635. - _Clark Kimberling_, May 07 2011

The positive eigenvalue of the real symmetric 2 X 2 matrix M defined by M(i,j) = max(i,j) = [(1  2), (2  2)] is (3+sqrt(17))/2, while the negative one is (3-sqrt(17))/2. For a generalization, see A085984. - _Bernard Schott_, Apr 13 2020
A quadratic integer with minimal polynomial x^2 - 3x - 2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 14 2020
xref: Cf. A082486 (decimal expansion of (5+sqrt(17))/2), A010473 (decimal expansion of sqrt(17)), A109007 (repeat 3, 1, 1), A085984.
results.author: _Klaus Brockhaus_, May 24 2010
